mapper.sql: seqno, name, age, sex, createon, createby, modifyon, modifyby
mapper.insert: insert into student (seqno, name, age, sex, createon, createby, modifyon, modifyby) values (#{seqno,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{sex,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{createon,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{createby,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{modifyon,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{modifyby,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

seqno,

mapper.update:
update student
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
age = #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER},
sex = #{sex,jdbcType=CHAR},

createby = #{createby,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
modifyon = #{modifyon,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
modifyby = #{modifyby,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where seqno = #{seqno,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update student set name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, age = #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER}, sex = #{sex,jdbcType=CHAR}, createon = #{createon,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, createby = #{createby,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, modifyon = #{modifyon,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, modifyby = #{modifyby,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where seqno = #{seqno,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select count(1) from student where 1=1
and name like '%${name}%'
and age like '%${age}%'
and sex = #{sex,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
